The outer feels so crunchy when you bite it and inside it full of cream. The cream was not too sweet nor bland. Just nice to my taste bud. I like it, and will come again to try other flavours. | review_rating:5, text:Ordered Chouz vanilla and durian musang king. Personally I like it, not too sweet and just nice.

In terms of serving speed, there is room to improve. Have been waiting for more than 10 mins even though it’s only 3 orders ahead me. can see a cashier who also help with filling, one staff handle the filing and another one is baking. name: Akemi Home
location: G1.113A, Ground Floor, Sunway Pyramid, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:Bought 1 HIROMU SOFA set on the 3rd_Nov, PROMISED to delivered before Christmas but came in after 1/1/2025.
Worse think is what you saw, what you felt, what you paid for were not what they delivered
We bought the HIROMU SOFA set because of its COMFORT. What they delivered is just another ordinary SOFA Set. HARD AND NOT COMFORTABLE. THEY DONT HAVE CLOUD-LIKE COMFORT LIKE THE SHOWROOM UNIT.

We complained, they said they can't do much as their factory is in Ipoh (who care where is your factory as I'm buying from AKEMI).

We even asked them to exchange the SHOW ROOM UNIT with the new SOFA SET that they delivered but they said cannot.
We went to the store want them to send their staff to personally go to our house to "feel" the sofa delivered but they declined.
Finally they agreed to come over to check on the SOFA delivered but it is 2 weeks later i..e. SUNDAY 26JANUARY 2025. My goodness, is this AKEMI customer service? I personal feeling is that they will not turn up citing CNY, TOO BUSY! | review_rating:1, text:Buying bed sheet sets , surprise to find out that I need to pay RM5 for a bag ??!! Understandable if this for apparel or grocery , that we can use our own bag ; but this is a furnishing store … buying bed sheet sets , wasn’t prepare to put them all in my bag or bring a recycle bag 😠 and the bag it’s RM5 each !!!
Staff team is patient and well mannered , rating 1-star for this stupid policy 🤦🏻‍♀️ | review_rating:1, text:Im a regular customer of Akemi. I used to purchase bedsheet set through the website. This time i gave try purchasing at the physical store at Akemi Sunway Pyramid. Came on 04/02/2025 around 7:50pm. The staff was busy doing nothing than talking with each other. When i try to approach them, it seems they doesn’t like to serve me and just giving the cheap look. (Maybe because im indian)….Rude and unfriendly staff (especially the soft guy). I will not return back here and will not purchase anything by Akemi. Thanks for the disappointing service🙏 | review_rating:4, text:No Review | review_rating:5, text:No Review

name: Nail ShahSo
location: LOT F1.AV.173 &175 (First floor) Sunway Pyramid, Blue Atrium , Asian Avenue, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:I NEVER NEVER NEVER have experienced such a scam in my entire life! This service is the worst service you can imagine, it's literally STEALING from customers! HOW can clients be charged so much for such poor service!
I asked for a basic manicure for 48RM, I was far from imagining that this only included nail trimming, no foot soaking, no cleaning, no filing of heels! absolutely nothing, just cut nails, file nails! when I asked the lady who did the pedicure if my feet should not be filed and if it was included in the pedicure, she told me yes but that my heels are hard, so she recommends the medical pedicure (88 RM) rather than the basic one! I thought it would be better, it was worse! She attacked the skin on my feet without wetting them or cleaning them, she just put a tiny bit of emollient product for the heels which she left on for less than 2 minutes, that's all, and she removed the calluses using a special blade. No scrub, no wash, no mask, no massage, no filing, in 15-20 minutes everything was finished and the cashier charged me for 2 pedicures! I paid for 136 RM for just cutting my nails, buffing them a little bit and cutting the callus wich is a scandal! It’s not about money, it’s a question of principles, and it was extremely disappointing!
And by the way : zero hygiene, zero professionalism, zero service, zero skills. | review_rating:5, text:Fantastic nail service
Na Na actually understood my requirements I was so happy as I wanted same color
Excellent job by Susan
I recommend this nail parlor 👌👍 | review_rating:5, text:I do manicure and pedicure at Sunsuria Forum Setia Alam few years ago. Really love the service. I used halal nail color for my nails. | review_rating:5, text:I saw my girlfriend’s nails and feet after her manicure and pedicure, and they look amazing! She’s super happy with how they turned out. Her nails look neat, and her feet are so soft. She’s definitely feeling relaxed and pampered. I’m really glad she had such a great experience! | review_rating:5, text:Had such a relaxing and wonderful experience at Nail Shahso! The staff was friendly, professional, and paid great attention to detail. My nails turned out beautifully, and the whole process felt so pampering. The ambiance was cozy and clean, making it the perfect place to unwind.

Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for top-notch nail care. Will definitely be coming back! 💅✨

From the moment you step inside, you’re greeted with a vibrant atmosphere and an impressive array of shops, making it a perfect destination for shopping, dining, and entertainment. The mall is vast, with a wide variety of stores, from high-end fashion boutiques to trendy local brands, ensuring there’s something for everyone.

The design of the mall itself is stunning, with its iconic Egyptian-themed architecture adding a unique flair. The spacious layout makes it easy to navigate, and the many open areas and atriums offer a refreshing break from shopping.

What stands out the most is the variety of dining options. Whether you’re in the mood for casual bites or fine dining, Sunway Pyramid has it all. From international cuisines to local favorites, the food court and restaurants offer a delightful selection to suit any taste.

For entertainment, the options are just as diverse. Whether you’re catching the latest blockbuster at the cinema, having fun at the ice skating rink, or exploring the interactive attractions, there’s never a dull moment at this mall.

The staff are always friendly, and the overall experience is top-notch. Sunway Pyramid truly caters to every need, making it a perfect spot for family outings, friends’ gatherings, or solo trips. A place where shopping meets fun and excitement—highly recommend it! | review_rating:5, text:My visit to Sunway Pyramid was an incredible experience. This iconic shopping mall, with its distinctive pyramid-shaped exterior, offers a unique blend of shopping, dining, and entertainment. The vast array of stores includes both high-end brands and popular retail chains, catering to all tastes and budgets. The themed sections, like the Egyptian-inspired design, add an extra touch of excitement and novelty. We also had the chance to watch live ice hockey, which was an unexpected thrill! The mall is so large that we could only explore about a quarter of it in a day. The food court and various restaurants provide a diverse selection of cuisines. Whether you're shopping, dining, or enjoying the entertainment, Sunway Pyramid offers a vibrant and memorable experience 🛍️🍔🏰🏒

name: Nando's
location: 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Subang Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:The atmosphere of this place is really inviting with its modern and unique interior design. The wooden framework on the ceiling adds a distinctive touch, creating a cozy and relaxed vibe. The lighting is just right not too bright making it comfortable to sit and enjoy a meal for a while.

As for the service, the staff seem efficient and quick in attending to customers, even though the place can get quite busy. The arrangement of tables and chairs is comfortable, with enough space to maintain some privacy. Overall, it’s a great spot to hang out and enjoy a meal with friends or family. The atmosphere and service here definitely make for a pleasant dining experience. | review_rating:5, text:Always loved grilled chicken from Nando’s. During our stay at Sunway pyramid hotel we visited this outlet of Nando’s several times . Service was always satisfactory and food was served quickly so we didn’t had to wait for the food whenever we were in hurry . Alhamdulillah our overall experience was always satisfactory. Tried their burger for the first time and loved it . Would definitely recommend this place in shaa Allah (SWT) !! | review_rating:1, text:Having lunch here after walk around the mall we choose nandos for our lunch.. que was normal but really shocking after get ice chocolate for rm15.90 one serving and bottomless rm7.90.. ice chocolate just normal taste like mamak milo rm3.50 for that price and i really upset on that.. PLUS!! GET FORK LIKE ON THE PICTURE that i almost get the cut on my lips, i cant imagine if my 7 years old daughter had it.. i call your staff regard this and tell her, guest what her reaction??  Just take it and show to her friend and laugh.. funny isnt your client almost having injury with no say sorry and just act like that was nothing. And today the restaurant feel hot and didnt feel the aircondition.. really feel bad experience. . . Mood spoiled whole day event have a good morning time with my family.. food ok but services is hmmm... I AM SO PISSED AND UNHAPPY.. | review_rating:5, text:Everything was great. I went there twice. Food was great, atmosphere was great and staff were amazing. We got a muffin free on valentine's day too. Would recommend! | review_rating:4, text:Tried dinner at Nando's. Tried it several times in other countries, trying to like the sauce. The chicken is good, but not to my taste for the sauce.

reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Very large. If I lived here, I would take a few months to even fully explore the place, much less try out all of the stores. Pretty fun, lots to eat and shop, so honestly it's worth living nearby. Food isn't very pricey so that's also a plus. | review_rating:4, text:As a frequent visitor, here’s my take on Sunway Pyramid:
•	Diverse Shopping: With a wide array of shops, it caters to all family members, from fashion to gadgets.
•	Family-Friendly Activities: The mall features an indoor ice-skating rink and a massive arcade that are perfect for kids and adults alike. My daughter loves to play at Parenthood. They have upgraded it too recently and we enjoyed it.
•	Food Haven: Offers an extensive selection of dining options from fast food to upscale restaurants. For Indian food you can try Mantra Restaurant (Not great but decent)
•	Convenient Layout: Despite its size, the mall is well-organized, making navigation easy.
•	Themed Decor: The Egyptian-inspired architecture adds a unique charm, making every visit memorable.

name: JOHNNY’S RESTAURANT
location: LG2.55 & LG2.55A, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Subang Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:4, text:Food was average. Look wise need to improve. Using dark soya sauce all the food looks darker.the mango salad was good and refreshing. | review_rating:3, text:Fish glue is frozen, glass noodle only 1 prawn, soup is ok, and Thai tea is good. Service needs improvement. One Utama Johnny's is far better. | review_rating:1, text:Service so bad, this is 3 rd time happened to me. I order my food, after waiting for 25 minutes, suddenly the crew n supervisor advice my order not available. I understand it's a peak season but please don't waste customers time waiting. | review_rating:1, text:The customer service was very cold, odd & bewildering.
The atmosphere as per exhibited by the waitress was bordeline hostile.

Question:

1. Is it the SOP that takeaway customers are not allowed to be seated in order to view the menu & make the selection?

The restaurant was only a handful of customers since it was after lunch hour (1521 hours). Thus, there are a lot of empty tables. In addition, there were no customer queuing anyway.

2. Is it the SOP that takeaway customers is warranted to wait outside of the restaurant while awaiting for the meal to be ready?

It really baffles me that I was not allowed to be seated because I have chose to takeway my meals.

The waitress in a way insisted me to wait outside for my meal, whereas, I have ordered 2 drinks for dine-in (the drinks were noted as takeaway in the receipt, even though I have stated otherwise).

If not because of one (1) of the waiter (a gentleman), I would have to stand outside while waiting for my meal.

3. Is it the SOP as well for the customer to clear the table from the drinks which were consumed as dine-in?
(As aforementioned, the drinks were packed as takeaway, whereas I had it ordered as dine-in).

This is my 1st & final visit to Johnny's (Sunway Pyramid's branch). | review_rating:2, text:The service was mediocre at best, there's a stupid robot waiter with songs playing like its necessary to have it.

we sat at the table near the cash register and behind it is the dishwashing station, while we're eating, the staff kept throwing dishes in the sink with no utmost regard for the patron and making loud noises.

it's so noisy that we can't eat in peace, while we want to ask for more sauce we can see nobody is really looking over the table eager to serve, had to yell to get their attention.

maybe the management don't really care for the customer wellbeing.

name: Mantra Indian Cuisine
category: indian_restaurant, sandwich_shop, thai_restaurant, meal_takeaway, restaurant, point_of_interest, food, establishment
location: LG2.122, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Located in the bustling Sunway Pyramid, Mantra Restaurant offers a welcoming escape for those craving hearty and flavorful Indian cuisine. The restaurant boasts a warm, casual setting, making it a great spot for a relaxed meal amidst the shopping hub’s vibrant energy.

For our lunch, we opted for the Vegetarian Banana Leaf Set, which came with a refreshing Iced Lemon Tea. The meal arrived promptly, with a generous spread of rice, assorted vegetable curries, crispy papadam, and flavorful condiments neatly arranged.

The portions were more than satisfying, ensuring a fulfilling meal. The variety of vegetable dishes offered a good mix of textures and flavors, from creamy dhal to tangy pickles and spiced stir-fried vegetables. Each component complemented the others, creating a well-balanced and wholesome dining experience.

The Iced Lemon Tea was a welcome addition, providing a refreshing contrast to the warm, spice-laden dishes. While not overly sweet, it had just the right amount of tartness to cleanse the palate between bites.

Service was efficient and friendly, with the staff ensuring our needs were met without being intrusive. Given the reasonable pricing and generous portions, the meal felt like great value for money. | review_rating:5, text:It is such a wonderful dining experience. The two waiters are patiently waiting for our order. We ordered vegetarian thali set that comes with a serving of naan. The side dishes are so nice, the naan is crispy and fresh. We had paneer with black dhal and tomato, which is excellent! What a great choice. We added another serving of Kashmiri Pulao rice, and it is so good. The cashew nuts are crunchy and fresh and added such flavour to the rice. We had maggo lassi to finish. What a wonderful dining experience. Highly recommended. | review_rating:5, text:Best Indian food in this side of KL. I was on long stay at the sunway pyramid hotel and a regular visitor here, whenever I get a craving for Home food taste.
Amazing Serving experience, even the samosa is served with fresh salad and ketchup.
All their food items are prepared very well and reasonably quick. The prices are slightly on the higher side, but totally acceptable considering this shop is inside a Mall.
The ambience is excellent as well!
I highly recommend everyone to go here. | review_rating:5, text:I ordered the chicken biryani, but it was just okay, with the rice portion being disappointingly small. The naan was overly crispy, almost like a papad, which was not what I expected. The paneer masala was merely satisfactory, lacking the flavor I was hoping for. On the positive side, the ambiance was pleasant and enjoyable, creating a nice dining environment. Overall, the food didn’t quite live up to expectations, but the setting made it a decent experience. | review_rating:3, text:Looks like a potentially great place but other than the authentic decor and playing, the food really disappointed. The mango lassi was so sour, the masala tea was spicy more than milky/sweet. Thankfully the main dishes were better but overall is not was the best Indian dining experience. If you’re dining here, I can recommend the rice, chicken tikka and prawn curry.

name: Dandy
location: LG2-128A, Blue Atrium, Sunway Pyramid, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Subang Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:3, text:Ordered the mixed grill, falafel platter, and summer at the sea. The food was quite good. They were grilled and fried nicely, with balanced taste. However, the portion was quite small, considering the price was on the higher side. The Lebanese coffee was  good. Services were good. Staff were friendly and attentive. | review_rating:4, text:We ordered 3 main dishes and 4 drinks. The quality, presentation and portion of the food is pretty good.

Our mix platter were generally okay. My son love the yogurt sauce and I think he complimented it at least 10 times. Lol. The lamb meat is a little on the tough, chewier side. The kebab is also a little dense. Chicken breast cutlets a little overcooked. Hummus needs more olive oil & I would prefer if you don't spread it so thinly on the plate. By the time it is served it almost dried out. Probably just spread on certain portion of the plate and keep it thicker.

The beef burger (served using a pita bread) is good. My only comment is the sauce used in it taste a little like cheap cheese sauce. Otherwise, the nachos, salad are good. The meat inside is flavorful but still also on the dense side. I think maybe is the same meat mixture as the kebab.

The buffalo wings batter is really crispy. The fries are done so well. Super crispy and well seasoned.

The drinks were all great in taste and presentation.

We love the atmosphere and the service attitude. ♥️ | review_rating:4, text:Good menu variety, very unique fusion of modern mediterranean food. Place is comfortable and bright, and service is good. Loved the nachos and especially that dipping sauce that came with it.
Ordered the falafel wrap because it seemed pretty unique. Taste was great but somehow it didn't sit well with my stomach later on.
We got the free baklava set from signing up and honestly it was not too sweet and just nice. Overall, I'd recommend to still give this place a try. | review_rating:5, text:The shop are beautiful and clean. Apparently, it just opened 4 weeks ago. The waiter mentioned that there are a few other branches. The food is delicious.

It was my first time trying Lebanese coffee. The coffee wasn’t too strong and suited my taste. It also had a hint of cardamom and a slightly spiced flavor.

All the staff were very kind and customer-friendly. The prices of the food were quite reasonable and not too expensive. Worth it. However, the downside is that the internet at the shop was a bit weak, so ordering online was a bit slow and challenging. Hopefully, the management will take note of this.

1) lebanese coffee 5🌟
2) Original Roaster 5🌟
3) Dandy buffalo wings 4.8 🌟
4) Dandy Rib-Eye 5🌟 | review_rating:5, text:Visited Dandy and we were absolutely impressed by the great taste and variety of food! Each dish we tried was packed with flavor and prepared to perfection. The menu offers such a wide selection, making it hard to choose – which is why we’ll definitely be coming back to explore more of their offerings. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a satisfying dining experience!

name: Pineyard
category: coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
location: LG2.133, 31, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:4, text:Pineyard is a new cafe that opened up in the Oasis section of Sunway Pyramid. They were having a 20% discount offer for their hot food offerings when I visited.

I ordered the chicken pie that came with a side of brown gravy and mashed potato. The pie crust was okay although I wished it was a little lighter and fluffier. It was also not as warm as I would have preferred it. Nonetheless, the filling was flavorful with a mix of chicken and mushroom. For the price however, they could have given more pieces of chicken.

Service was relatively fast although there were only 2 occupied tables. Seating was comfortable and the decor had a nicer minimalist look that I appreciate. | review_rating:4, text:I popped into Pineyard at Sunway Pyramid with my mum recently, hoping to find a cosy spot for brunch. We decided on the grilled sourdough sandwich first; it was nicely buttered and crisp on the outside but turned out rather hard and chewy. The filling of mushrooms, spinach, and cheese had a lovely flavour, albeit a bit on the oily side.

The carbonara was rich, creamy, and made even more indulgent by a runny poached egg. The deep-fried chicken ham added a satisfying crunch and extra savouriness. We also had an iced gula melaka and an orange juice—both decent choices.

Price-wise, Pineyard leans slightly towards the higher end, but I must say the service was prompt and friendly. | review_rating:5, text:I had their carbonara for dinner and it was so good, I really love it. I also bought their pasties and they're really soft even if you eat it the next day.

The price for the dish and pastries are slightly expensive but I'd say it matched with the quality of the food.

Staffs are excellent, they're friendly and professional.

Overall my experience here was lovely and I'd love to drop by this place again in the future. ☺️ | review_rating:5, text:The food here is absolutely amazing! Every dish is bursting with flavor, fresh ingredients, and beautifully presented. The service is friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. Highly recommend this place if you’re looking for a delicious meal! | review_rating:4, text:I am not usually a fan of pastries but their salted egg croissant was unexpectedly delicious. Shame about their latte though its quite bad, so because of that have to minus 1 star.

review_rating:5, text:Coach Yu Fen has been an exceptional coach who creates positive and comfortable environment. Her patience , clear instruction made my girls enjoy the swimming classes throughout the years. We will miss you badly! | review_rating:5, text:A very good and clean environment for your child to swim. My daughter has joined Happy Fish since she was 6 months old. Can see that she has great progression. Thanks to coach Sandara who is very friendly and encouraging🩷 | review_rating:5, text:Spacious area with warm pool. Full length 50m, but they partitioned it during regular classes.
Plenty of rooms for shower and even for babies. | review_rating:5, text:My 5 year old son is learning to swim with private lessons from coach Ten. He is an excellent swim coach, very patient, very kind and what is most impressive is how he finds creative ways to teach. My son enjoys his lessons immensely and has progressed really quickly. The amenities in happy fish is great, plenty of shower rooms and the pool area is big. It has never felt too busy, always an enjoyable lesson. | review_rating:5, text:We signed our baby since he was 6 months, and can see his progression after 3 months. location: F1.02, First Floor, Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:Bad service. I was regular customer to young heart before and it was fine and ok BUT the service was totally lousy today and rude.

The Malay staff(never saw her before first time)is so rude to my aunt and me  is bad attitude and tone of voice rise up when asking people very rude also side eye to us i was trying to find a suitable product but she never introduce and explain nicely to ppl also show the “face” to customers won’t come again! If you don’t know how to treats customer well go and learn how to service people with polite way and speaking also. Don’t recommend to this shop. Worst experience I can said. | review_rating:1, text:The service is bad! This is my first time purchase Youngheart product. The malay stuff was so rude to me the way she speak and with sarcastic tone. It seems she does not know how to respect customers. If you don't know how to service people go and learn from your mistake no need treat customer this way. I am just a customer I need to view and see which one suitable for me why so rush and rude when asking? Some more d Senior Chinese Staff (at cashier there) does not give a chance to try 2nd round even if size is same. Terrible Service leh....  I won't buy again at tat place n don't recommend! I thought sunway standard should be nice and polite and it came out to be this worst experience... | review_rating:1, text:I would like to advise for people who go to this shop, please ensure your payment amount or any buy x free x promotions information before you pay. Separate all the product in categories. This is my worst experience which bought 500 something in this shop and the seller didn’t explain clear just kept promote. | review_rating:1, text:Not recommend won't come again bad service tq | review_rating:5, text:They have the best service

name: T&T Station
location: 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Very large. If I lived here, I would take a few months to even fully explore the place, much less try out all of the stores. Pretty fun, lots to eat and shop, so honestly it's worth living nearby. Food isn't very pricey so that's also a plus. | review_rating:4, text:As a frequent visitor, here’s my take on Sunway Pyramid:
•	Diverse Shopping: With a wide array of shops, it caters to all family members, from fashion to gadgets.
•	Family-Friendly Activities: The mall features an indoor ice-skating rink and a massive arcade that are perfect for kids and adults alike. My daughter loves to play at Parenthood. They have upgraded it too recently and we enjoyed it.
•	Food Haven: Offers an extensive selection of dining options from fast food to upscale restaurants. For Indian food you can try Mantra Restaurant (Not great but decent)
•	Convenient Layout: Despite its size, the mall is well-organized, making navigation easy.
•	Themed Decor: The Egyptian-inspired architecture adds a unique charm, making every visit memorable.

It is connected to Sunway Lagoon. | review_rating:5, text:Sunway Pyramid is truly a shopper’s paradise and a fantastic destination for entertainment, dining, and more. The mall is enormous, with a wide variety of stores ranging from luxury brands to affordable options. The unique Egyptian-themed architecture makes it stand out, creating a visually stunning experience as you explore. The food court offers an excellent selection of delicious cuisines, and there’s always something happening, from events to exciting attractions. The staff is friendly, and the facilities are well-maintained. A perfect place for a family outing or a day of shopping—highly recommend! | review_rating:5, text:Sunway Pyramid is truly a gem in the heart of the city! From the moment you step inside, you’re greeted with a vibrant atmosphere and an impressive array of shops, making it a perfect destination for shopping, dining, and entertainment. The mall is vast, with a wide variety of stores, from high-end fashion boutiques to trendy local brands, ensuring there’s something for everyone.

The design of the mall itself is stunning, with its iconic Egyptian-themed architecture adding a unique flair. The spacious layout makes it easy to navigate, and the many open areas and atriums offer a refreshing break from shopping.

What stands out the most is the variety of dining options. Whether you’re in the mood for casual bites or fine dining, Sunway Pyramid has it all. From international cuisines to local favorites, the food court and restaurants offer a delightful selection to suit any taste.

For entertainment, the options are just as diverse. Whether you’re catching the latest blockbuster at the cinema, having fun at the ice skating rink, or exploring the interactive attractions, there’s never a dull moment at this mall.

The staff are always friendly, and the overall experience is top-notch. Sunway Pyramid truly caters to every need, making it a perfect spot for family outings, friends’ gatherings, or solo trips. A place where shopping meets fun and excitement—highly recommend it! | review_rating:5, text:My visit to Sunway Pyramid was an incredible experience. This iconic shopping mall, with its distinctive pyramid-shaped exterior, offers a unique blend of shopping, dining, and entertainment. The vast array of stores includes both high-end brands and popular retail chains, catering to all tastes and budgets. The themed sections, like the Egyptian-inspired design, add an extra touch of excitement and novelty. We also had the chance to watch live ice hockey, which was an unexpected thrill! The mall is so large that we could only explore about a quarter of it in a day. The food court and various restaurants provide a diverse selection of cuisines. Whether you're shopping, dining, or enjoying the entertainment, Sunway Pyramid offers a vibrant and memorable experience 🛍️🍔🏰🏒

name: 30DEGREES
location: LG1.02, Lower Ground One, Sunway Pyramid, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Sunway City, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:2, text:The quality of the innerwear from this brand is actually quite good, and for my size (F100) they are one of the few that holds large size and have more than 3 back clip which i love, aside from that, the customer service is average.

My sister and I just recently purchased innerwear from here (22/4/2023) and the employees there are quite alright, I manage to find my size but my sister took some time in finding it, which she later noticed its not the right size for her on that day when we got back home.

I understand its her incompetence when it comes to choosing something you wear everyday and still able to choose wrong. So we went back to the store for an exchange (24/4/2023) and it's a different staff this time. Though I find this employee to be somewhat irritated due to her tone when she's serving. But the biggest problem was that she secretly CUT OFF the price tag after my sister had finally done choosing the right size WITHOUT informing us and for me, that just leaves a sour taste in my mouth.

I believe staff have to at least inform the customers that they will cut off the price tag due to whatever reasons presents. Either its because customers can only exchange product once or any other reason at all, for the staff to cut off the price tag like that is just another stamp approval of me not visiting this store anymore.

I'm not sure about the name of the employee but I believe the Person in charge can find out who that is. (24/4/2023. 12.46pm) | review_rating:5, text:Their zero bra is so comfortable and soft yet offers good support and securely fits.   Customer service lady  is quite knowledgeable and helpful. Sometimes need to visit their other branches  for the popular colors and  designs that quickly ran out of size or stock. | review_rating:5, text:On behalf of my girlfren, found tat tis brand inner wear is awesome. Customer Service is exceed expectation because they will give suggestion n advise. Keep it up, kudos! | review_rating:1, text:Service very BAd | review_rating:1, text:Service is so rude

name: Oriental Kopi
category: coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
location: G1.108 & 1.109 Ground Floor, Sunway Pyramid, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Oriental Kopi at Sunway Pyramid is a consistently popular spot, drawing crowds with its lively atmosphere and efficient service. Whether you’re grabbing a quick bite or settling in for a meal, the staff ensures a smooth and welcoming experience. The menu features a great mix of local favorites, with their signature egg tarts being a standout—crispy, buttery pastry filled with a rich, velvety custard. Their coffee is equally impressive, strong and aromatic, making it the perfect complement to their sweet and savory offerings. Despite the long queues, service remains quick, and the vibrant setting adds to the overall charm. A great place to enjoy classic flavours in a bustling yet comfortable environment. | review_rating:5, text:Awesome food and service here. Love the speed of food served and quality. Their egg tart coffee is famous. I like their chicken rice

Warning. Come early to avoid long queues

Baby seat limited but we got a sofa. Think its something they need to work on | review_rating:2, text:Food was so so. Not worth the queue and calories. Was expecting to be awed but the taste of the food which I had ordered did not meet my expectation.

Service is good and staff are friendly. The only consolation I had from the meal was the Coffee with Cincau. That's the best I had!

Had visited the highly raved place but will never go back for food except to have my coffee take away. | review_rating:4, text:A popular and well-visited restaurant that offers good food with high quality. There is always a queue to get in and it is worth the wait. Today I tried Malay Fried Rice, Egg Tart and Cincau Cold. It was tasty and refreshing. | review_rating:4, text:This restaurant has a pretty long cue when we arrive. That’s just natural given how popular and the reputation it has among the locals like myself. I only visited their branch in KLIA but not the one here.

So when my family arrived at this branch this morning, there was a pretty long cue. But what I admire most was how quick their staff got their act together in ensuring each waiting customer gets welcome and directed to their seats while not getting them to wait too long. I personally thought their service was pretty professional and efficient.

Their environment was pretty spot on as it gives off the classy kopitiam vibes.

Now, when it comes to their food & beverages. Their coffee is certainly not bad but is definitely not the best I’ve tried. Their famous Ipoh Hor Fun was rather bland and am not too sure why it’s much to shout about. I certainly have tried much better Ipoh Hor Fun out there. But don’t let that ruin your entire experience at this restaurant. The saving grace for me and is one of their must try dishes if you’re here is their Nasi Lemak and their Kaya & Butter Toast bun as well as their Oriental Polo Bun. Am glad that it wasn’t a completely letdown and negative experience.

It’s definitely a good place to have breakfast or tea time. Be sure to check this place out!

name: Hooga
category: furniture_store, home_improvement_store, home_goods_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
location: LG2.57 & LG2.58A, Lower Ground Two, Jalan PJS 11/15, Sunway Pyramid, 46150 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:3, text:This Singaporean store had increased the price to 20% & 40% on all items in the store, compared to last year. Even the store doing the current promotion with 15% off on all regular items in the store but still unable to get back the last year price anymore. Please look for alternative at others place, they are NOT the only one in the shopping mall | review_rating:4, text:There's always something special about visiting a shop like HOOGA, especially when you're there with your loved ones. It's almost akin to the magical feeling you get when you visit IKEA, for me at least, where you can imagine buying furniture for your home. Loved the ambience, choices of colors and the neatly arranged items for sale. Everything feels premium and of high quality regardless of which product you are looking for. Have a go, you won't be disappointed. | review_rating:5, text:We come back to the same Hooga shop every year to buy things back home! It’s funny because we always meet the same sales assistent and he’s always so good In his services!!! Always helpful with stock advise and questions for the different items In the shop! Always smiling and helpful! Great packaging for the things we have to carry back home and we were able to leave the stuff In the shop while we shopped in other stores!!! Believe me - the quality of the items is the best! There is always the best discounts on the items In the shop! CHEAP COMPARED TO THE QUALITY YOU RECEIVE!
They have the softest and best quality for bedding - you will sleep like an angel! And the diffuser section is AMAZING! we had ours for home and still smell amazing after almost a year! | review_rating:1, text:There was an Indian staff member named Chew who had a very unfriendly attitude at work. He looked down on me for buying things and had a very bad attitude. | review_rating:5, text:Hooga here has s special place for plants. They have artificial plants, pots in different designs and also some stuff for pets.

name: Oltre Moda
location: LG 1. 91, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:I visited this shop over the weekend, and unfortunately, had a negative experience with one of the Malay staff members, who seemed to speak with a Kelantanese dialect. She appeared to be in her 40s and was quite rude, often rolling her eyes and speaking in a very harsh manner. Her communication with customers was poor, lacking politeness and respect. To make matters worse, she made inappropriate comments, even body-shaming customers.

Although the dresses sold here are beautiful and reasonably priced between RM100-250, I decided not to make a purchase because of this sales assistant's rude behavior. She didn’t smile, was unprofessional, and her attitude completely ruined the shopping experience. Credit to the owner for offering such lovely products, but I suggest ensuring that staff have better attitudes to avoid driving customers away. | review_rating:5, text:The shopkeeper was very good at picking dresses for me to try according to my company annual dinner theme: masquerade night. I was quite worried that I can't fit the dress because I am quite plump. However, the dress fit perfectly without any alteration and showing my waistline, making me look slim. The dress is within my budget too. Will definitely visit the store again. | review_rating:1, text:worst quality experience in my life ever. glitter dropped everywhere with purchased rm300+ "AFTER DISCOUNT" somemore. bad quality which you can find any better one around the mall with reasonable price. not going to stepped in again. what a nightmare! | review_rating:5, text:Discovering this shop was a delightful surprise as my family and I shopped for a graduation dress. Rain, the shop assistant, proved to be a true asset with her exceptional service. She effortlessly guided us to the nicest dresses, and we ended up purchasing three, finding them worth every penny. The next day, when I wanted to exchange a dress for a lighter color, Rain's fashion expertise shone through as she suggested unique patterns I hadn't considered. This shop not only offers adorable designs at reasonable prices but is elevated by Rain's professionalism and genuine understanding of customers' needs. It has become my go-to destination for stylish attire, and Rain is undoubtedly the gem that makes the shopping experience truly remarkable. Highly recommended for those seeking quality and personalized service. | review_rating:4, text:I went there to buy a dress yesterday and I honestly enjoyed it. Even though the sales lady was quite rushed, she will still ask you whether what type of dresses you are looking for? If you wanted it sleeveless or not etc. and she pick some dresses for you to let you try on and she would go ahead of her way to get even more dresses and see if you would look good on it or not.

name: Gordon Ramsay Street Pizza
location: LG1.46A, Lower Ground 1, Sunway Pyramid, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:I had an amazing time dining here with my family. We love the Pizza here very much! It’s delicious! The pizza are made from sourdough. The thickness of the pizza  is just how I like my pizza to be. As for the price? It is alright for us considering how large it is. The service was good.. warm and friendly. Will definitely come back here again! Definitely one of my favourite pizza place now for sure! | review_rating:5, text:The pizza was absolutely amazing, taste and size. Came here with my family and all of us enjoyed it. We ordered beef pepperoni since it’s a classic, tried the crab and bacon pizza, and mac & cheese which all are delicious and thin crust just the way we like it. The drinks also are nice. Service was immaculate, friendly and accommodating. Definitely will come again. Do say Hi to Chef Gordon 😁. | review_rating:3, text:The pizza is a disappointment. It is not piping hot when served. Probably was cooked earlier? The dough is not soft and the toppings are too little for the price paid - RM 62 for one. I rather have a small pizza full of good toppings than a big one with sparsely scattered toppings. Also with such big size pizza, you can't even try other things.

There's no place to wash your hands. I have to use the mall's toilet. I thought pizza is supposed to be eaten by hand? Street pizza right?

Fortunately, the service staff are good. | review_rating:5, text:Good service and good food. We ordered bottomless pizza and drinks, can unlimited until your full. The service team and head chef very nice service. Our annual anniversary very happy. Thanks you so much, must come again. | review_rating:3, text:I feel that the food is quite average. Pizza was okay, couldn't really taste the pulled lamb on the pizza. The signature French fries with fried chicken and baked with cheese also so so. The French fries was a bit soggy. The beef lasagne was slightly warm and it is not served hot. Hence overall the experience was average and the food price is on the high side. Likely, we won't be visiting again.

name: Pet Lovers Centre
location: LG2.108 & 109, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:1 persons job but needed 3 to do so!
If only there's a 0⭐ available

As customers actually we don't expect much, just a simply customer service like 'hi, sorry to keep you waiting behind, how can we help, or pls wait a while' rather than buat bodoh doing 1 simple task which 1 person could literally do it but takes 3 for this 3 champions and kept customers waiting behind. | review_rating:5, text:I don’t understand why the cashier asked me to rate my customer service experience (she even asked me to press the button harder lol) with the fact that i came here for the first time and find everything on my own. | review_rating:5, text:As always, good service from the staff. Just get their membership card for 5% discounts.

But the shop quite congested, so have to be careful if you’re bringing big shopping bags 😂 don’t knock things over.

I came here to get my cat food, meowing head. So far one of the best for my cats. And they shed less fur with this dry food. | review_rating:1, text:On 18/7/2024@5.45pm, im going there to buy some of treats for my fur babies.. its took only RM20.95.
Already paid using debit card.. and the transaction is successful..
but suddenly the indian guy.. come run to me.. he said the transaction was failed (he said because the payment receipt not come out from the machine) , but at the same time, my account deduct the money already .. so need me to repay back .. because of the staff lack of knowledge, forcing like crazy, keep saying stupid things, very bad on problem solvings (which is, they have to call their bank centre first, because of so lazy to do so, they choose to force customers to pay double with guarantee bank will refund the money). so i have to pay another RM20.95 but until now no refundable from bank..
so total i spend is RM 41.90 for only treats that cost me RM20.95 . Such a scam! ..
Not worth it..i won’t go here again! | review_rating:5, text:I’ve gotten hamsters from them and they’re all so cute!!! The staff there makes sure the hamsters are good and healthy before you bring them home and they even give you some tips for hamster care! 100% recommend getting hamsters there if you’re interested

name: Kebab King
location: 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews: review_rating:1, text:First time trying so ordered chicken kebab and requested for add on chicken RM6 but I’m shocked to see the amount of chicken given! I spent RM11 for the original kebab and RM6 for the add on. Unbelievable! Small chicken bits and it’s really daylight robbery. Will not buy again. Very disappointed. | review_rating:1, text:Wanted to take away something quick for child on the way back home. This must be one of the worst kebab purchases I made locally. RM11 and it contains little chicken (taken from some Tupperware, not cut in front of you), hard bread and last minute 'put into toaster' action. Basically threw it away, regretful purchase. Nothing against the 'foreigner' manning this kiosk, it's just not worth it. Any Subway is few hundred times better. | review_rating:1, text:This shop used to be my favourite back then. But recently came here for beef kebab + extra kebab + canned soft drinks that cost me RM30 (I didn’t take the receipt since I always came here). The kebab doesn’t really taste like meat kebab. More to kebab with chilli sauce & a lil bit of cabbage. I don’t know why its getting so expensive but they don’t maintain the service. How can you put extra charge and reduce the meat at the same time. It’s not worth it. RM30 can get better food elsewhere. Sila mereput. Bye. | review_rating:1, text:Bought meat kebab. Got only vege with lots of sauce. Very less meat portion. Pricy. A few years back was better.Now not worth it at all! The owner must have told the staff to make like a million kebabs from the small portion of meat. Look at the photo. Hardly can see any meat. Not gonna repeat ever. | review_rating:5, text:I understand they have to reduce meat because of rising costs and rent. Those who rely on a fixed income (makan gaji) will never understand. So, in order to get the same taste as 20 years ago, I will order 'extra meat'. It tastes so good! It's difficult to find a kebab stall that bakes its bread.

name: AVEDA
location: Malaysia, Selangor, Petaling Jaya, Bandar Sunway, G1.125B, Ground Floor邮政编码: 47500
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:I was drawn to the free scalp check sign while I was strolling through Sunway Pyramid. The staff truly knows how to explain and offer recommendations, which improved my impression of their products and brand even though I don't know a lot about the brand. Now, when it comes to hair care products, Aveda is one of my fave brands. Along with a soothing shoulder massage, their scalp check treatment was very useful in establishing the health of my scalp. My overall satisfaction with their services and goods is excellent. | review_rating:1, text:I recently visited this establishment for a hair and scalp review, but unfortunately, the experience was not pleasant. The staff who greeted us had a sullen face and made us feel unwelcome right from the start. This was disappointing as it's not the kind of experience you want when seeking professional advice.

During the review, the staff member assigned to us couldn't provide much helpful advice regarding the scalp issue we were experiencing. It was clear that more training is needed for the staff to be able to give expert advice to customers.

After we decided to purchase a few items, we noticed a change in behavior from one of the staff members who became friendlier. However, the other staff member still maintained an unprofessional and unfriendly demeanor, which was a letdown.

Overall, the experience was not great, and the staff's behavior was disappointing. We hope that management will take appropriate action and ensure that their staff are better trained to provide customers with a welcoming and professional experience. | review_rating:1, text:I went there for a scalp check but the promoter said they don’t  provide that particular facility in Aveda sunway pyramid , and the best part is they had a board promoting the scalp and hair check. So if you have an idea of checking your scalp , please do not go to aveda sunway pyramid , you would be dissapointed! | review_rating:1, text:I went there freaking no one is there, I have a lot of things to do and waited more than 15 mins when the sign is written “toilet break for 15 mins” | review_rating:4, text:No Review

name: Wah Chan
location: Lot No. LG 2.141, Lower Ground 2, Sunway Pyramid, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 46150 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Two thumbs up for Lilian Leong, highly recommended to look for her, bought a bangle and necklace from her. Excellent service! Very polite and friendly, very patient. Explain everything very clearly to me. All the staff here are very welcoming. Lot of design to choose from. Sure will come back if I need to buy more jewellery. | review_rating:5, text:6 July 2024, first time bought a gold bracelet gift for my mom as a teenager. To be honest i dont have much knowledges about gold, but Mr.Derreck explained well & very friendly service from him… i came last week to choose the design, normally must give deposit if you want to buy later but i promised him i really want to buy few days later and he kept for me ! .. the way he treat  me ( customer ) as a salesman really makes me inspired to buy more golds 😆✌🏻… nice gold design, nice service, nice environment 😃✌🏻 | review_rating:1, text:Had a terrible experience with Wah Chan. TRIED TO SCAM ME. I went there to trade in my gold ring, and this sales guy didn't even bother to test it or anything. He just held it, weighed it, and told me the gold purity is 720 and only worth a grand. My gold is actually 999. If you're thinking of trading in your gold, STAY FAR AWAY from Wah Chan. I would give it negative star or zero star if I could. | review_rating:5, text:Derreck was the salesperson. We initially were just comparing prices. He was very genuine and knowledgeable, hence we decided to purchase gold from him. Customers may look for him in the future :) | review_rating:5, text:First time getting my first solitaire diamond earring and a diamond band from Wah Chan in Sunway. We were served by a lovely lady named Lilian. She was down to earth and most importantly no pushy. We felt comfortable with her , we purchased our jewelries without hesitation.

Thank you again Lilian.
We will come back again! ☺️

name: Hong Kong Kim Gary
location: OB2-G-U3, Ground Floor, Oasis Boulevard 2 Sunway Pyramid Shopping Centre, No.3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 46100 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:4, text:They offer a real thick menu with so many options that it took us a while to decide what to order😂. But it was worth the time— the food was great and definitely worth its value. The staff were attentive and friendly 👍🏻👍🏻 Waiting time slightly long (30mins) as it  was super packed on weekend.

The only downside was the presence of a lot of flies inside, made the place look a bit unhygienic. Hopefully, this can be addressed soon. | review_rating:4, text:The food here not bad. Just hardly get to see the menu via online.
sharing these photo on the menu food that I love to eat 😋 | review_rating:5, text:Food quality is not bad altho the price is abit high. Service is fast and food is served fast too | review_rating:4, text:Soup is tasty. But cheese baked rice is not as tasty as it was at many years ago.
Hot charm is very nice.

Comfortable and wide environment.
Got indoor and outdoor seating. | review_rating:4, text:Menu& price: Wide range of Hong Kong style food options provided to different dietary group with inclusion of vegetarian on separate menu. You still can find vegetarian Borscht soup here. Kudos to Kim Gary. Could explore further by providing more neutral vegetable ingredients on vegetarian dishes than mock meet. Reasonable price range for set around RM20-25

Food& service: Fast serving and using electronic order with paper menu which is easier to see. Well known for their cheese baked rice with pork rib, Yin Yong tea, Borscht soup. Overall taste good. Their vegetarian curry is sufficient.

Wheelchair accessible to restaurant.

Recommended place if you dine in with vegetarian friends / family together.

reviews:
review_rating:1, text:Very bad. I bought 3 boxes colour lens at rm120 which is promo and it’s can’t fit my eye. I return 2 boxes open and they charged me rm60 which they should purated to rm40 per box. Not worth to buy from this shop. There have a lot better service from optical shop inside Sunway pyramid which u may consider. | review_rating:5, text:Came in to get new glasses done on Monday, Arisya assisted me with checking my power and helped picked out a a really nice frame. She’s very patient (I took a long time to choose the frames 😅) so friendly and knowledgable about the lenses and frame. Very pleasant experience. Expected to come back the following week but I got my glasses on Saturday! So far there hasn’t been an issue with my new pair. They have an array of stylish and modern frames, flexible temples. Highly recommend coming here. | review_rating:5, text:Senior salesperson at this shop was very helpful in helping me to search for a new frame to fit an old lens. He took his time from frame to frame until one fitted in perfectly. Most other shop I went earlier just told me that the lens had to be shaved or the lens only fit for that particular frame I had.

Superb service. 👍🏻 | review_rating:5, text:Leon was very helpful and friendly. Shop has lots of options. Highly recommended! | review_rating:1, text:I just bought a spec with a frame+ super thin bluecoat lenses at 100 Vision Sunway Pyramid. It doesn't worth the price and I felt that I get con! Is a thicker lenses and got dizziness a week! Salesperson was inexperience and didn't understand the needs of customer! Tricking them with incorrect information and poorly explanation! Definitely won't shop at this shop anymore!

name: The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf
category: cafe, breakfast_restaurant, restaurant, point_of_interest, food, establishment
location: Ground Floor, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 46150 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:One of the slowest coffee bean cafe. Queue is super lengthy despite have 6 workers. I had terrible experience ordering for Spanish latte. I request without sugar but they remove the vanila powder . Not only that, the cashier was hesitate to accept card payment. I insist since i left my wallet at home. I heard an indonesian girl feels upset as she do not have cash at that time and want to use card payment. Usual order usually takes 30 mins for a cup of coffee. The queue was the most painful part | review_rating:4, text:The atmosphere is good for a quick break or catching up with friends. The service was fast and efficient. Had their cold brew and  bagels, coffee was good and bagels were absolutely delicious. Definitely a spot I'd recommend for anyone looking to relax and enjoy a good snack or coffee. | review_rating:1, text:My experience with Coffee Bean usually good But this one at Sunway Pyramid is worst.  When ordering, this cashier shown a sour face.  Don't answer question. And show me an impatient attitude in ordering.  It's Saturday 14 sept. As usual a busy weekend. But I felt the customer does not deserve a sour face.  The cashier can smile or laugh with the staff/ colleagues but not to the customer is something very wrong.
If you the management of coffee bean, pls do something. Improve staff competency and attitude. You are in the F&B industry.
I believe you can find your staff at the receipt attached. | review_rating:5, text:A very convenient joint located at G floor of Sunway Pyramid. You can enjoy your coffee and meal while watching people skate. Or it is a perfect place to have a sip or two while waiting your loved ones do their shopping .

This is not my first time here. Been here many times for their nice food, good coffee, good vibes, and yes.... clean toilet is nearby. What a good  setup.

Great service too. I think it is an enjoyable place to meet up with friends or to complete simple paper work, as I always see people with their laptops.

Starting your day with a perfect blend of good coffee and being surrounded with many people from all walks of life....is always amazing. | review_rating:2, text:First CBTL outlet that refuses to give me a straw for iced drink. Staff said straws are reserved for “ice blended” beverages only. Is this policy only applicable to this outlet? Coz other outlets just give me one straw for each cold beverage without any problems.

name: VCR
location: G1.112A & 1.112B Ground Floor, Sunway Pyramid, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Had an awesome meal here three days ago, and I have to say, everything was top notched! The pasta was amazingly scrumptious; perfectly cooked, full of flavour, and just the right balance of ingredients. And that coffee? So smooth and creamy, with beautiful latte art. You have to give a shot on their desserts; especially the cakes and croissants. They are absolutely delicious; flaky, fresh, and just the right amount of sweetness. The perfect way to end a great meal.

Huge shoutout to Fernandez for making the experience even better. He was super friendly and mindful, and made sure we had everything we needed. Honestly, the kind of service that makes you want to come back again and again.

The vibe of the place was also really nice; cozy yet stylish, perfect for bringing each other up to speed or just enjoying a great meal. If you’re looking for amazing food, great coffee, and top-notch service, this is the place to be. Frankly and definitely coming back soon!

P/S: Forgot to snap the atmosphere and the deco of the place  since I got so caught up with the meals served. | review_rating:4, text:VCR was recommended to me by a few of my friends who frequent the KL branch. The food was quite good even if the menu was somewhat limited. I had the Wagyu Burger, and it was not bad at all. The only issue was that it was quite small. The other dishes were fine, though, and the pricing is quite reasonable overall. The ambience of the restaurant is quite nice with a very relaxed and cool vibe to it, especially in the evenings. This makes it a great place for dinner with friends and/or family. Most of the offerings in the menu are western dishes, though, so if you like pizzas, burgers, and pastas, you will like VCR. Recommended! | review_rating:3, text:Feel quite disappointed with the food, maybe it’s just the things we ordered 🤷‍♀️ The pepperoni pizza has a plastic taste but they were quite generous with the cheese. As for the burgers, suggest to add some greens on the side because overall felt very jelak and not balanced.

Espresso tonic was good 👍 Customer service needs improvement. The waiters and waitresses were quite blur and not very smart at planning tables causing people to wait in line or sit awkwardly. | review_rating:5, text:Visited VCR this afternoon and had a great experience. The staff were warm and welcoming which the waitress attended politely and in a professional way. This makes me feel so open-sided without any restrictions. The food tasted great and the portion sizes were reasonable. The only consideration is the price's higher side. However, the quality and ambiance make it a worthwhile visit. A nice place to relax and enjoy a good meal !!! | review_rating:5, text:First time here to dine, it was lovely, I was at the entrance looking at the menu, the waitress was very observant and attentive, she came and greet us and ask how many people to be dine in here. Love the fried chicken with waffles. The carbonara to me just average, love the art on the coffee look like a seahorse, it was all good. Plain water are free of charge. So you can actually not to order any beverages. I really like this place, would definitely come back here to dine again.

name: Simple Life Healthy (Vegetarian)
location: F1. 86A, FIRST FLOOR, Oasis 3, Sunway Pyramid, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Had been to other branches of Simple Life. This time, there's a noticable taste quality that is not up to mark. Taste are milder and lack certain memorial flavours. We hope the Chefs can make this branding great again. Expended menu. Service and price are reasonable. | review_rating:5, text:Quiet and rustic, this restaurant is a hidden jewel tucked away behind the hustle and bustle of the Orange Atrium. I only found this place as my hotel had a convenient path to the mall. Honestly, this place is better than I expected. Large, generous portions, and staff were very courteous. 10/10. Recommend the lei cha, hotpot and the mushrooms(deep-fried) Will definitely come back when I have the chance. | review_rating:5, text:Amazing vegeterian food, and the food is presented very nicely as well. The portion is really big and well-worth the price. Most importantly, the food here are much healthier than the normal Malaysian food.

There are so many great drink options and I was pleasantly suprised at how big the drink was. They are very generous with the toppings (longan, goji berries, and red dates).

There are so many interesting options on the menu and I cannot wait to come back again to try! | review_rating:5, text:Simple Life is Back and Better!

I used to be a regular customer before the old store closed. After trying the other branches, I was disappointed by the noticeable drop in quality. However, a friend told me Simple Life was back in Sunway, and after she enjoyed her visit, I decided to give it a chance.

I’m so glad I did! Simple Life has definitely come back stronger. This is my second visit here, and I’ll definitely return—most likely every time I’m in Sunway! | review_rating:5, text:Simple Life provides excellent meal prep and its atmosphere is very calming. I throughly enjoy the food and staff is very friendly ☺️

name: Beryl's
category: chocolate_shop, candy_store, dessert_shop, confectionery, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
location: Lot LG2 K10, Sunway Pyramid, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:It was the worst experience in Malaysia.
I spent about 160MYR at the store.
When I was paying my goods, I JUST asked to them It is possible to pay cash and card separately.
But she laughed right in front of my face with very rude attitude.
I don’t know Malay language, so I couldn’t understand what they said each other.
But I totally can feel they ignore me through the atmosphere.
after paying, I said that I don’t need receipt, then she said “oookaaayyyy”.
Is it right attitude of the server to customers?
This store needs to HR education more. | review_rating:1, text:Worst sales representative I have ever met in my life. I think she is working without pay and that is the reason beryl's don't want to change after so many negative reviews.... | review_rating:5, text:Read thru some reviews, many were pissed off by the staff. However, im on the opposite side. Find the staff quite helpful, perhaps its a different staff. Visited on Thursday, 31/10, around 11am - 12pm | review_rating:1, text:The lady of the casher was terrible.
No smile, no Thank you to the customers, no hospitalization at all.
She never treated the product gently, it was so rough.

She is not qalified to be a sales of Beryl's.
She needs to be trained more. | review_rating:5, text:Very good variety of chocolate.

name: Oriental Kopi
category: coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, store, point_of_interest, food, establishment
location: G1.108 & 1.109 Ground Floor, Sunway Pyramid, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Oriental Kopi at Sunway Pyramid is a consistently popular spot, drawing crowds with its lively atmosphere and efficient service. Whether you’re grabbing a quick bite or settling in for a meal, the staff ensures a smooth and welcoming experience. The menu features a great mix of local favorites, with their signature egg tarts being a standout—crispy, buttery pastry filled with a rich, velvety custard. Their coffee is equally impressive, strong and aromatic, making it the perfect complement to their sweet and savory offerings. Despite the long queues, service remains quick, and the vibrant setting adds to the overall charm. A great place to enjoy classic flavours in a bustling yet comfortable environment. | review_rating:5, text:Awesome food and service here. Love the speed of food served and quality. Their egg tart coffee is famous. I like their chicken rice

Warning. Come early to avoid long queues

Baby seat limited but we got a sofa. Think its something they need to work on | review_rating:2, text:Food was so so. Not worth the queue and calories. Was expecting to be awed but the taste of the food which I had ordered did not meet my expectation.

Service is good and staff are friendly. The only consolation I had from the meal was the Coffee with Cincau. That's the best I had!

Had visited the highly raved place but will never go back for food except to have my coffee take away. | review_rating:4, text:A popular and well-visited restaurant that offers good food with high quality. There is always a queue to get in and it is worth the wait. Today I tried Malay Fried Rice, Egg Tart and Cincau Cold. It was tasty and refreshing. | review_rating:4, text:This restaurant has a pretty long cue when we arrive. That’s just natural given how popular and the reputation it has among the locals like myself. I only visited their branch in KLIA but not the one here.

So when my family arrived at this branch this morning, there was a pretty long cue. But what I admire most was how quick their staff got their act together in ensuring each waiting customer gets welcome and directed to their seats while not getting them to wait too long. I personally thought their service was pretty professional and efficient.

Their environment was pretty spot on as it gives off the classy kopitiam vibes.

Now, when it comes to their food & beverages. Their coffee is certainly not bad but is definitely not the best I’ve tried. Their famous Ipoh Hor Fun was rather bland and am not too sure why it’s much to shout about. I certainly have tried much better Ipoh Hor Fun out there. But don’t let that ruin your entire experience at this restaurant. The saving grace for me and is one of their must try dishes if you’re here is their Nasi Lemak and their Kaya & Butter Toast bun as well as their Oriental Polo Bun. Am glad that it wasn’t a completely letdown and negative experience.

It’s definitely a good place to have breakfast or tea time. Be sure to check this place out!

name: Wong Kok Char Chan Teng
location: F1.55, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:4, text:Service has improved a lot since my last visit here years ago. Their menu is still extensive. Ordered the crispy dory fish on pineapple fried rice. The fish was huge in portion, but the fried rice was very very tasteless.
But overall, I would still return because of the variety. | review_rating:1, text:Extremely disappointed with 2 foreigners staff on their attitude, wondering why the restaurant able to tolerate such employee
If you take this survey seriously, please review back the CCTV to check the time around 1900 to 2030 | review_rating:1, text:horrible food & bad service.
no one come & approach us when we enter the shop, we go inside & find our own seat.

The food taste so so bad, i don’t recommend anyone to come try it out, but you can try if you want.

the baked cheese pork rice taste so horrible. As u can see from the picture, the rice is not well mixed with the sauce, the texture of the rice is bad as well, weird smell (think they didnt wash the rice properly), the texture of the pork is hard, which i believe it’s a overnight food.

sorry for giving such a bad review, but quality control & taste of the food have to be improved if you want more customer coming in. (this is my honest opinion from my pov, if anyone wanted to try, you are welcome to.) | review_rating:5, text:We had lunch here and found the decor pleasant. Food was served soon after ordering. The set lunch is very worth the price as the food serving is large and comes with soup and coffee or tea in a tall glass. They also have breakfast and all day set meals. | review_rating:2, text:Yesterday tried this Hong Kong-style restaurant and ordered their chicken chop with egg and rice. I was genuinely shocked by the portion size—the egg was the smallest I’ve ever seen, and the chicken chop was so thin it felt like eating paper. Just two small bites and it was gone.

While RM15.90 isn’t expensive, I’ve dined at other Hong Kong-style restaurants in Pyramid, and they consistently serve generous portions. Unfortunately, this place didn’t meet those standards. Even the hot tea was disappointing.

This was my first visit, and it will definitely be my last. Not recommended.

name: VCR
location: G1.112A & 1.112B Ground Floor, Sunway Pyramid, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:Had an awesome meal here three days ago, and I have to say, everything was top notched! The pasta was amazingly scrumptious; perfectly cooked, full of flavour, and just the right balance of ingredients. And that coffee? So smooth and creamy, with beautiful latte art. You have to give a shot on their desserts; especially the cakes and croissants. They are absolutely delicious; flaky, fresh, and just the right amount of sweetness. The perfect way to end a great meal.

Huge shoutout to Fernandez for making the experience even better. He was super friendly and mindful, and made sure we had everything we needed. Honestly, the kind of service that makes you want to come back again and again.

The vibe of the place was also really nice; cozy yet stylish, perfect for bringing each other up to speed or just enjoying a great meal. If you’re looking for amazing food, great coffee, and top-notch service, this is the place to be. Frankly and definitely coming back soon!

P/S: Forgot to snap the atmosphere and the deco of the place  since I got so caught up with the meals served. | review_rating:4, text:VCR was recommended to me by a few of my friends who frequent the KL branch. The food was quite good even if the menu was somewhat limited. I had the Wagyu Burger, and it was not bad at all. The only issue was that it was quite small. The other dishes were fine, though, and the pricing is quite reasonable overall. The ambience of the restaurant is quite nice with a very relaxed and cool vibe to it, especially in the evenings. This makes it a great place for dinner with friends and/or family. Most of the offerings in the menu are western dishes, though, so if you like pizzas, burgers, and pastas, you will like VCR. Recommended! | review_rating:3, text:Feel quite disappointed with the food, maybe it’s just the things we ordered 🤷‍♀️ The pepperoni pizza has a plastic taste but they were quite generous with the cheese. As for the burgers, suggest to add some greens on the side because overall felt very jelak and not balanced.

Espresso tonic was good 👍 Customer service needs improvement. The waiters and waitresses were quite blur and not very smart at planning tables causing people to wait in line or sit awkwardly. | review_rating:5, text:Visited VCR this afternoon and had a great experience. The staff were warm and welcoming which the waitress attended politely and in a professional way. This makes me feel so open-sided without any restrictions. The food tasted great and the portion sizes were reasonable. The only consideration is the price's higher side. However, the quality and ambiance make it a worthwhile visit. A nice place to relax and enjoy a good meal !!! | review_rating:5, text:First time here to dine, it was lovely, I was at the entrance looking at the menu, the waitress was very observant and attentive, she came and greet us and ask how many people to be dine in here. Love the fried chicken with waffles. The carbonara to me just average, love the art on the coffee look like a seahorse, it was all good. Plain water are free of charge. So you can actually not to order any beverages. I really like this place, would definitely come back here to dine again.

name: Zen House Japanese Vegetarian Restaurant
location: LG2.99, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:5, text:We had lunch here and found the decor pleasant and restaurant clean. Service was polite and food served soon after ordering. The bento sets we ordered were delicious with large quantity of food. It was also nice that the green tea was refillable. We had a  nice meal here and will be back to try other items on their very extensive menu. | review_rating:5, text:The best Japanese vegetarian food that I have tried. Even bought takeaway after eating in the restaurant. Recommend to eat the food while it is hot! Service was great, slightly pricely but worth it. | review_rating:4, text:I was delighted to discover this Japanese vegetarian restaurant after browsing a few options at the Sunway Pyramid mall. Finding vegetarian dining options beyond the typical Chinese restaurants can be challenging, so I was pleased to come across this establishment.

For my meal, I ordered an egg roll dish, okra skewer, and kimchi soup ramen. While the okra skewer may not have had the most visually appealing presentation when it arrived at the table, I was pleased to find that the okra was not overcooked. Instead, it maintained a satisfying crunchiness, which is how I prefer my okra to be prepared.

The kimchi ramen was decent overall, though I didn't particularly enjoy some of the ingredients, such as the bean sprouts and cabbage. Personal preferences aside, I appreciated the opportunity to find a suitable vegetarian restaurant option within the Sunway Pyramid mall.

Overall, I'm glad I was able to discover this Japanese vegetarian restaurant, as it provided a refreshing change of pace from the more common Chinese vegetarian offerings in the area. It's always encouraging to see a diverse array of meatless dining options becoming available. | review_rating:5, text:Wonderful Japanese food for vegetarians! Loved the katsu don and inari sushi especially. | review_rating:4, text:If you are in vegeterian and looking for Japanese food, this is a great place to be. Their sushi and shasimi really tasted 'real'. Good food. Only complain is their wasabi does not have the kick as you usually in a normal Japanese restaurants.

name: CMY
location: F1.23 & F.23A,Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 46150 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
reviews:
review_rating:1, text:Totally a joke, I remember that gentleman who served me has totally 0 knowledge on the product, the funny part is we all should  how important a power supply is in a HiFi product. Quoting what that gentleman says "upgrading a lps for a DC in product makes no sense, as it's not 240V AC in type" you can't compare.

You are feeling a bit lost here? No worries, I believe he has no idea what he is talking about, they even bash their own product and having the mindset of expensive stuff must always be better. I believe a salesman who works in Hi-end HiFi shop should have the basic knowledge, having someone shytting on the brand they carry just because it's cheaper, and the fact that he doesn't appreciate the difference a good power supply can do in a system even for a DC in product, I don't think that guy is qualified for the job.

Furthermore, the guy is being very impatient and kinda rude, you will get a feeling of they don't want to serve you if you don't bring a stack of cash and put it on the counter to show them you are a serious buyer. Definitely would not buy from such guy even if I like the system.

As someone who has bought from other CMY branch, I feel disappointed with such service was provided.

There are more to add, when I try to test him out if he knows what he is selling. the product definitely said "analog volume", which switches between relays for the volumes control. When I bring up this topic, he is very sure that it's a false claim from the manufacturer, he claims that all manufacturers claim so, but it's a chip base digital gain volume control. So I would appreciate that if the salesman learn more about the product they are selling, if you are unsure, don't act like you know all of them. Thanks | review_rating:1, text:Very good service when you want to purchase but extremely bad service when need to repair or service the audio system bought from them, take ages to only troubleshoot the issue and not able to resolve the problem by months…this should not be happening for branded & expensive audio system | review_rating:5, text:Outstanding quality hi-fi & sound products.

Fantastic Service! Great products with brilliant recommendations & most of all peerless after sales service especially from Steve & friendly professional mates.🙏🏻🙇🏻‍♂️ | review_rating:5, text:Recently i was bought a set of Hi-Fi system. I been here many times and this round i decide bought a system with CMY @ Sunway Pyramid due to staff STEVE & Wei, provide a good quality and knowladgeble with patience and warm hospitality.
Keep it up CMY | review_rating:5, text:Been there recently,variety of amps and speakers here,the staff name, Yap is very kind and responsive to my question. highly recommended!
